casebody.data:
FREEDOM FINANCE CO., INC., A CORPORATION OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, PLAINTIFF-APPELLANT, v. NEW JERSEY BELL TELEPHONE COMPANY AND HELEN RUTH KEYES a/k/a HELEN RUTH BROWN, DEFENDANTS-RESPONDENTS. Superior Court of New Jersey Appellate Division Submitted January 15, 1974 Decided February 4, 1974.

Before Judges Kolovsky, Fritz, and Crane.

Mr. John S. Qiava, attorney for appellant. *376Mr. Chaimcey L. Barrett, attorney for respondent New Jersey Bell Telephone Company, filed a statement in lieu of brief. Respondent Helen Ruth Keyes, a/k/a Helen Ruth Brown, did not file a brief. Mr. George F. Kugler, Jr., Attorney General of New Jersey, Intervenor-Respondent (Mr. Stephen Shillman, First Assistant Attorney General, of counsel; Mr. Bertram P. Goltz, Jr., Deputy Attorney General,- on the brief). Per Curiam.

We affirm, substantially for the reasons set forth by Judge Yanoff in the opinion below, 123 N. J. Super. 255 (Cty. Ct. 1973).
